item.title: Tokyo Clanpool Uncut Edition announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Pre-orders open on January 22.

eastasiasoft will release a physical Tokyo Clanpool Uncut Edition for PC, the publisher announced. Pre-orders will open via Play-Asia and eastasiasoft store on January 22 at 7:00 a.m. PT / 10:00 a.m. ET, with shipping expected for early 2026. International shipping will also be available if ordered via eastasiasoft store. An Uncut Edition patch will also be available for users who have already purchased the game digitally via GOG.

Here is an overview of the Uncut Edition, via eastasiasoft:

This updated release of Tokyo Clanpool restores all the original content from the Japanese version of the game and will include faithful localization in English and Traditional Chinese text. Additionally, for those who already own the GOG release of Tokyo Clanpool digitally, an off-site patch will be made available to restore content that required removal from previous versions of the game. We have now officially confirmed the cancellation of Tokyo Clanpool‘s release for Nintendo Switch in North America and Europe, making Tokyo Clanpool Uncut Edition for PC the definitive physical option for collectors.

Tokyo Clanpool is originally developed by Compile Heart and Idea Factory, and this Uncut Edition will be published exclusively by eastasiasoft. The game will be included on a uniquely branded USB drive along with a soundtrack CD, art book, poster, sticker sheets, acrylic character standees and numbered certificate in a collector’s box, priced at US$49.99 plus shipping. Fulfillment is expected in early 2026. Only 1,000 units will be produced. We have greatly appreciated customers’ patience as this special announcement was being prepared.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/tokyo-clanpool-uncut-edition-announced-for-pc
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Tides of Tomorrow delayed to April 22
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

No longer due out on February 24.

publisher THQ Nordic and developer DigixArt have delayed Tides of Tomorrow, its first-person adventure game with a multiplayer influence system, from its previously planned February 24 release date to April 22. It will be available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam.

“Following extensive feedback gathered from the Tides of Tomorrow playable demo and an ongoing closed beta, the development team determined that additional time is needed to respond to player input and implement improvements,” THQ Nordic said in a press release. “This extra development period will help ensure the best possible experience for the upcoming narrative-driven adventure.”

A demo for Tides of Tomorrow is currently available for PC via Steam.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/tides-of-tomorrow-delayed-to-april-22
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Demon Kill Demon: Yomi 1984 launches for Switch on May 28 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

New dystopian dungeon RPG from Experience.

Dystopian dungeon RPG Demon Kill Demon: Yomi 1984 will launch for Switch on May 28 in Japan, developer Experience announced. The digital edition will cost 3,900 yen. The physical edition price will be announced when pre-orders open in mid-February.

Here is the story synopsis, via the game’s official website:

Five years have passed since the “Imprisonment” incident involving an underground explorer. Once again, the darkness lurking in the underworld bares its fangs.

The targets were the students of Yomi High School.

In the hell where their entire classrooms were transported, their only means of survival was to resurrect the corpses of their classmates and use them as assets in battle.

That is not a choice. It is the only thing they can do in order to live.

The curtain rises once more on a dystopian dungeon RPG.

View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

Screenshots

  • ❮
  • ❯
